title: BET Awards 2025: Complete List of Winners (Updating Live)
description: Hosted by Kevin Hart, the BET Awards celebrated its 25th year on Monday with a three-hour ceremony honoring Black excellence in music, movies, sports and beyond. Heading into Monday’s ceremony, Kendrick Lamar led the pack with 10 nominations, followed by Doechii, Drake, Future and GloRilla, each of whom netted six nominations. The BET Awards are […]
author: Andy Swift
excerpt: Who won big at the 2025 BET Awards? Keep up with our list, which we'll update as winners are revealed throughout the show.
text: Hosted by Kevin Hart, the BET Awards celebrated its 25th year on Monday with a three-hour ceremony honoring Black excellence in music, movies, sports and beyond. Heading into Monday’s ceremony, Kendrick Lamar led the pack with 10 nominations, followed by Doechii, Drake, Future and GloRilla, each of whom netted six nominations. The BET Awards are also celebrating several living legends this year, bestowing the Ultimate Icon Award upon Mariah Carey, Jamie Foxx, Snoop Dogg and Kirk Franklin. So, how’d they do? Read on for a full breakdown of this year’s nominees and winners, which we’ll update as the trophies are handed out during Monday’s live show. Once you’ve processed the results, drop a comment with your thoughts on the 2025 BET Awards. Were any of your favorites robbed of a win? html:
Hosted by Kevin Hart, the BET Awards celebrated its 25th year on Monday with a three-hour ceremony honoring Black excellence in music, movies, sports and beyond.

Heading into Monday’s ceremony, Kendrick Lamar led the pack with 10 nominations, followed by Doechii, Drake, Future and GloRilla, each of whom netted six nominations.

The BET Awards are also celebrating several living legends this year, bestowing the Ultimate Icon Award upon Mariah Carey, Jamie Foxx, Snoop Dogg and Kirk Franklin.

So, how’d they do? Read on for a full breakdown of this year’s nominees and winners, which we’ll update as the trophies are handed out during Monday’s live show. Once you’ve processed the results, drop a comment with your thoughts on the 2025 BET Awards. Were any of your favorites robbed of a win?

ALBUM OF THE YEAR

11:11 (Deluxe), Chris Brown
Alligator Bites Never Heal, Doechii
Cowboy Carter, Beyoncé
Glorious, GloRilla
GNX, Kendrick Lamar
Hurry Up Tomorrow, The Weeknd
Some Sexy Songs 4 U, Drake and PartyNextDoor
We Don’t Trust You, Future and Metro Boomin

VIDEO OF THE YEAR

“3AM in Tokeyo,” Key Glock
“A Bar Song (Tipsy),” Shaboozey
“After Hours,” Kehlani
“Denial Is a River,” Doechii
“Family Matters” Drake
“Not Like Us,” Kendrick Lamar
“Timeless,” The Weeknd featuring Playboi Carti
“Type Shit,” Future and Metro Boomin featuring Travis Scott and Playboi Carti

VIEWER’S CHOICE AWARD

“Residuals,” Chris Brown
“Denial Is a River,” Doechii
“Nokia,” Drake
“Like That,” Future and Metro Boomin featuring Kendrick Lamar
“TGIF,” GloRilla
“Not Like Us,” Kendrick Lamar
“Luther,” Kendrick Lamar featuring SZA
“Brokey,” Latto

BEST COLLABORATION

“30 for 30,” SZA featuring Kendrick Lamar
“Alter Ego,” Doechii featuring JT
“Are You Even Real,” Teddy Swims featuring Giveon
“Beckham,” Dee Billz featuring Kyle Richh, Kai Swervo and KJ Swervo
“Bless,” Lil Wayne, Wheezy and Young Thug
“Like That,” Future and Metro Boomin featuring Kendrick Lamar
“Luther,” Kendrick Lamar featuring SZA
“Sticky,” Tyler, the Creator featuring GloRilla, Sexyy Red and Lil Wayne
“Timeless,” The Weeknd featuring Playboi Carti

BEST MALE R&B/POP ARTIST

Bruno Mars
Chris Brown
Drake

BET HER AWARD

“Bloom,” Doechii
“Burning, Tems
“Defying Gravity,” Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande
“Heart of a Woman,” Summer Walker — WINNER!
“Hold On,” Tems
“In My Bag,” Flo and GloRilla

DR. BOBBY JONES BEST GOSPEL/INSPIRATIONAL AWARD

“A God (There Is),” Common and Pete Rock featuring Jennifer Hudson
“Amen,” Pastor Mike Jr.
“Better Days,” Fridayy
“Church Doors,” Yolanda Adams featuring Sir the Baptist and Donald Lawrence
“Constant,” – Maverick City Music, Jordin Sparks, Chandler Moore and Anthony Gargiula
“Deserve to Win,” Tamela Mann
“Faith,” Rapsody
